alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 03 at 5:21PM CDT until September 03 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTH CENTRAL JEFFERSON AND SOUTHWESTERN ORLEANS PARISHES... At 521 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flooding w2as reported over numerous streets. Although the heavier rain has ended additional light rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... New Orleans, Marrero, Harvey, Metairie, Avondale, Timberlane, Belle Chasse, Jefferson, Gretna, Harahan, Westwego, Bridge City, Elmwood and Terrytown. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 227 and 238. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
